title.rendered: This is how the eight groups of the 2022 World Cup were left

content.rendered:
This Friday the draw for the group stage of the World Cup in Qatar was held in Doha

At a Qatar 2022 World Cup draw ceremony in which world football legends such as Cafu, Jay Jay Okocha, Lothar Matthäus, Adel Ahmed MalAllah, Tim Cahill, Bora Milutinović, Rabah Madjer and Ali Daei were present.

President of the FC Barcelona clears the rumors of the return of Messi

The group stage of the World Cup was raffled, announcing the formation of the first series, in which the Peruvian National Team could have a presence, if it manages to beat Australia or the United Arab Emirates in the playoff game that will be played in the middle of June.

Those led by Ricardo Gareca could join Group D of the World Cup, the same one that would place them face to face with great teams on the planet, such as France, Denmark and Tunisia.

The Peruvian National Team already knows what it is like to play in a World Cup event under the orders of the ‘Tiger’, since it participated in Russia 2018, finishing third in the series that it also shared with France (later world champion), Denmark and Australia.

This is how the groups were formed:

GROUP A: Qatar, Ecuador, Senegal and the Netherlands,

GROUP B: England, Iran, United States, European Repechage.

GROUP C: Argentina, Saudi Arabia, Mexico and Poland.

GROUP D: France, Repechage 1, Denmark, Tunisia,

GROUP E: Spain, Repechage 2, Germany, Japan,

GROUP F: Belgium, Canada, Croatia and Morocco,

GROUP G: Brazil, Serbia, Switzerland and Cameroon.

GROUP H: Portugal, Ghana, Uruguay and South Korea.

*Repechage 1: Peru vs. Australia or United Arab Emirates.

*Repechage 2: New Zealand or Costa Rica.
